intro: Coccoloba grisebachiana, commonly known as the Jamaica nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive net-like venation on its leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually broad and heart-shaped, with a rough, sandpapery texture. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences.
